Ad Text:
ServiceNow Elite Partner - all onshore work - good work/life balance
Flexible work and strong focus on upskilling and internal progression
Multiple customers across both private and public sectors

********** AU Citizens or Permanent Residents only *********


About the company
  
At AC3, our purpose is to make technology real, and as the leaders in secure multi-cloud solutions, we get to do this for our customers every day. We are an Australian owned IT Services Company, with offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Auckland, servicing over 50% of the NSW State Government and over 1,200 enterprise customers in Australia & NZ.
  
Our expertise:

Cloud and infrastructure
Cyber security
Software and data integration
ServiceNow
  
We’re a company that believes in doing the right thing by our customers and each other, and delivering on our promises. Beyond getting to work with cool tech and cool clients, you’ll also find real recognition and flexible work that works for you.


About the role

Our ServiceNow practice successfully won major programs of work and we're growing the team!
We are on the lookout for a solid ServiceNow BA to join the team and work closely with our customers across various industries.

Some of your key responsibilities will be to: 

Contribute to the analysis and delivery of business process initiatives
Organise and facilitate workshops with customers - Meeting with user groups to gather and analyse end user requirements as required.
Create process maps and identify areas for potential improvement.
Provide sound operational and solution options either independently or jointly with Solution Architecture/Lead Engineering.
Develop functional specifications and document desired outcome of system enhancement/development.
Produce technical specifications to communicate user requirements in technical terms to stakeholders.
Coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure the overall efficiency, functionality and user friendliness of system enhancements.
Provide input directly into operational change management initiatives and training.
Provide subject matter knowledge on ServiceNow or other relevant Product capability for our customers during engagements.
Demonstrate detailed knowledge of products through the ability to accurately explain core system functionality, module
capability and configuration options.

Skills & Experience

3+ years’ experience in a business analysis role 
Proven ability to work on large scale transformation in the Public Sector or large commercial enterprise.
Strong knowledge across ServiceNow platform and modules such as ITSM, CMDB, ITOM, HRSD, LSD.
Experience in contributing to organisational change management efforts
Outstanding ability to analyse, isolate and interpret business needs and develop appropriate artefacts/outputs.
Proven ability to adapt and work under pressure in a complex
environment with multiple stakeholders and firm deadlines.
Industry certifications such as ServiceNow Certified System Admin (CSA) and ITIL Foundation certificate
Outstanding level of written and oral communications skills, with a confident, personable and professional manner.

Benefits
  

Exciting time to join an expanding Multi Cloud Solutions Provider and ServiceNow Elite Partner with excellent reputation
Varied engagements, environments and clients (corporate and government)
Work with some of the brightest minds in the Industry
Genuine flexible work environment (WFH & Office)
Strong investment in training and upskilling - certifications paid for
Mature team environment with a high level of engagement
Location: SYDNEY or MELBOURNE or BRISBANE
Facilities for socialising and relaxing
Lots of company social events
"Me Days" ~ equivalent to 1 extra week of annual leave
$110-$115,000 + super + bonus + benefits
  
Culture

People here have real relationships that go beyond work, and maintaining our awesome culture is a top priority at AC3. We believe it’s important that everyone is heard and treated with respect, whether you have the next big idea or simply a question. We keep it real and live by the AC3 way. The 3 simple elements of the AC3 Way are:

Work Wise– As one AC3, we put our combined skills to work to ensure we do more good, for much less. All in service of our customers and each other.
Work Humble– As a team, we bring our authentic selves to the world of tech. It’s our down-to-earth, humble nature that makes us unique and easy to work with.
Work Honest– We’re here to do an honest day’s work, individually and as a team. We’re constantly looking for opportunities to take the initiative and implement practical solutions.
We’d love for you to experience the AC3 way for yourself!

Business Analyst – Defence ERP Projects

Location: Canberra
Clearance: Baseline (NV1 highly regarded)
Work Type: Full-time

About the Opportunity

Blooming People is proud to represent a boutique consulting agency specialising in Defence transformation projects. We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst Consultant to support the Department of Defence’s ERP program within CASG’s Commercial Division.

This is a rare opportunity to contribute to one of Australia’s most significant ERP transformation programs, driving process improvement, digital enablement, and business readiness across the Procure to Pay value chain in SAP S/4HANA.

What You’ll Do

In this role, you will:

Deliver high-quality business analysis services that align Defence requirements with operational and system processes.

Analyse, prepare, and validate requirements with solution design, testing, and ERP/S4HANA implementation.

Develop artefacts and process maps to articulate current and future state business processes.

Provide technical expertise for data migration, reconciliation, and the Procure to Pay business solution.

Lead and support stakeholder workshops, manage UAT/PVT activities, and champion process improvement.

Work with cross-functional project teams, SMEs, and Defence stakeholders to ensure effective adoption of new processes and systems.

What We’re Looking For

We want to hear from you if you bring:

4+ years’ experience delivering business analysis in complex IT and/or Defence environments.

Strong knowledge of SAP S/4HANA and familiarity with ServiceNow.

Certification or practical knowledge in Agile, BABOK, IIBA, or Six Sigma.

Outstanding communication and facilitation skills, with the ability to engage stakeholders and translate complex requirements into actionable solutions.

Existing Baseline security clearance (essential); NV1 clearance preferred.

Why Join Us?

This is more than a role – it’s a chance to:

Play a critical role in Defence’s ERP transformation journey.

Work with a boutique Defence-focused consultancy that values honesty, integrity, and collaboration.

Join a high-performing, close-knit consulting team that partners directly with Defence.

Develop your skills in a fast-paced, high-profile ERP environment.

How to Apply

If you’re passionate about Defence transformation and have the skills to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply now through Seek or reach out to Blooming People to discuss how you can be part of this Defence consulting opportunity.
